title: Content
content:
Davinci Codex taken in Davince Museum in Popolo Square, Rome, Italy  Kevin’s Codex  ğŸ˜€ Leonardo Da Vinci’s studies in science and engineering are sometimes considered as impressive and innovative as his artistic work. These studies were recorded in 13,000 pages of notes and drawings, which fuse art and natural philosophy (the forerunner of modern science). They were made and maintained daily throughout Leonardo’s life and travels, as he made continual observations of the world around him.
